title: How to Make Gluten Free Pear and Almond Muffins

steps.headline: Peel the pears.
steps.description: Cut them into slices and place in the saucepan. Cover with water and cook them over a low heat until they form a pureé.

steps.headline: Break the eggs into the mixing bowl.
steps.description: Add the sugar and whisk the two together until frothy.

steps.headline: Add the rice flour, margarine, baking powder and flaked almonds to the egg mix.
steps.description: Pour in the puréed pear. Combine.

steps.headline: Add the soy or rice milk gradually, blending in as you mix.
Pour the mixture into the muffin pan.
steps.description: Add a few extra flaked almonds to the top of each muffin.

steps.headline: Place in the oven.
steps.description: Bake for 25 minutes at 180ºC/350ºC; turn the oven on at the same time that you add the muffins.

text: Peel the pears. Cut them into slices and place in the saucepan. Cover with water and cook them over a low heat until they form a pureé. Break the eggs into the mixing bowl. Add the sugar and whisk the two together until frothy. Add the rice flour, margarine, baking powder and flaked almonds to the egg mix. Pour in the puréed pear. Combine. Add the soy or rice milk gradually, blending in as you mix.  Pour the mixture into the muffin pan. Add a few extra flaked almonds to the top of each muffin. Place in the oven. Bake for 25 minutes at 180ºC/350ºC; turn the oven on at the same time that you add the muffins. Finished.
